subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Although {{lang|zh|年}} is the generic term for ''year'', years of age are typically expressed in {{zh-l|歲}}, a separate system based on the [[duodecennial]] orbital period of Jupiter. Ages in {{zh-l|歲}} are traditionally reckoned using the Chinese lunar calendar, beginning with 1 at the moment of birth and increasing not during birthdays but at the [[Chinese New Year]].

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ねん}}
From {{bor|ja|ltc|-|sort=ねん}} {{m|zh|年|tr=nen||year}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|-}} reading ''nián'', {{cog|hak|-}} ''ngièn'', {{cog|yue|-}} ''nin{{sup|4}}''.

# [[age]]

subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|年%神|^とし%がみ}}: the [[spirit]] or [[god]] of the [[year]]
* {{ja-r|年 を 取る|とし を とる}}: to [[pass]] [[New Years]]; to [[age]]
